citations.narrative:
Two primary enclosures contain carpets that are in disrepair with frayed edges. An enclosure housing an adult female dog
with 4 puppies and another enclosure housing an adult dog has carpet that is torn and damaged. Frayed edges can be
injurious to the regulated animal as they could ingest the material or could cause entrapment. All surfaces must be
maintained on a regular basis. Surfaces of housing facilities—including houses, dens, and other furniture-type fixtures and
objects within the facility—that cannot be readily cleaned and sanitized, must be replaced when worn or soiled. The
carpets must be maintained without frayed edges. Correct by 8-AUG-2023.

Enclosures are not being cleaned properly. In two sheltered enclosures housing 5 adult dogs, the door between the inside
and outside portion of the enclosure and the surrounding wall are soiled with a buildup of brown material. Inadequate and
infrequent cleaning and sanitization allows for the growth of disease-causing agents that may increase the risk of health
hazards towards the animals. Appropriate cleaning and sanitization of the surfaces must include removal of the buildup of
brown material found and to prevent accumulation of this material. All surfaces of housing facilities must be cleaned and
sanitized when necessary to satisfy generally accepted husbandry standards and practices. Correct by ensuring hard
surfaces with which the dogs come into contact with are spot cleaned daily and sanitized in accordance with 3.11 (b) of
this sub part to prevent accumulation of excreta and reduce disease hazards. Correct by 8-AUG-2023.

Two dogs at the facility did not have access to potable water. Two Dachshund puppies were placed outside in a
temporary primary enclosure and did not have access to potable water. Failure to provide continuous access to potable
water may lead to dehydration or discomfort to the animals. Potable water must be continuously available to dogs. The
licensee provided water to the puppies during the inspection. Correct by ensuring that potable water is continuously
available to all dogs at all times. Correct by 2-AUG-2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Licensee.
